Accountant Job at AOS Orwell Limited




        
    

        
        AOS Orwell Limited is the largest indigenous Oilfield Services Company in Nigeria. We offer a wide range of innovative products and services in Well Construction, Process Automation, Instrumentation & Control, OCTG & Conductor Casing services to the Oil & Gas sector. The company was founded in 1981 and rebranded AOS Orwell in 2011 following the merger between Africa Oilfield Services Limited and Orwell International.

AOS Orwell is an integrated indigenous oilfield services company in Nigeria offering well construction and engineering services to the oil and gas sector.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
     

            
    



Job Location: Rivers
Employment Type: Full Time

Responsibilities


	Ensures all direct and incidental cost of Assets are duly capitalized
	Maintains Fixed Asset Register
	Handles all Monthly prepayment and Amortization
	Prepares monthly MIS for the Company.
	Maintains all loans and interest calculations.
	Prepares Monthly Balance sheet and PL analysis.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or a related field.
	5 years of cognate experience preferably in oil & gas services or related industries.
	Professional Accounting Certification (e.g., ACA, ICAN) is mandatory.
	Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics is an added advantage
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organisational skills.
	High attention to detail with a focus on accuracy and compliance.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills for effective stakeholder management.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Content Manager",
  "description": "The Plug Entertainment Limited&nbsp;is a music distribution, licensing and publishing company. We manage some of the biggest talents in Africa, and curate phenomenal events. Founded in 2016, The Plug has rapidly penetrated the entertainment industry, boosting some of the most prominent young talents, either under management, publishing or promotional business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Content Manager&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Develop, implement and oversee content strategies for social media, websites, campaigns, brand partnerships and talent-related projects
	Collaborate with marketing, design, product and communications teams to ensure content aligns with brand voice, objectives and goals
	Collaborate with marketing, design, strategy and talent teamto support ongoing campaigns and activations.
	Lead brainstorming sessions and oversee content ideation and publishing schedules.
	Monitor performance using analytics tools and generate insights to optimize future content.
	Conduct content audits, competitor analysis and audience research for informed planning.
	Track performance using analytics tools and refine strategies.
	Support creative briefs and direction for campaigns and activations.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree with&nbsp;3 - 5 years of relevant work&nbsp;experience.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Trend-spotting and narrative development
	Content planning for multiple platforms
	Experience working with creatives and editors
	Knowledge of SEO and performance metrics

Job Description
     

            
    




	Develop, implement and oversee content strategies for social media, websites, campaigns, brand partnerships and talent-related projects
	Collaborate with marketing, design, product and communications teams to ensure content aligns with brand voice, objectives and goals
	Collaborate with marketing, design, strategy and talent teamto support ongoing campaigns and activations.
	Lead brainstorming sessions and oversee content ideation and publishing schedules.
	Monitor performance using analytics tools and generate insights to optimize future content.
	Conduct content audits, competitor analysis and audience research for informed planning.
	Track performance using analytics tools and refine strategies.
	Support creative briefs and direction for campaigns and activations.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 3 - 5 years of relevant work experience.


Skills & Competencies:


	Trend-spotting and narrative development
	Content planning for multiple platforms
	Experience working with creatives and editors
	Knowledge of SEO and performance metrics
	Strong storytelling and campaign alignment ability.
